meanings.definition: To swear more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the argument, he tried to outswear his friend.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outswear her siblings when they get into a heated discussion.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce as they both tried to outswear each other in a battle of words.
meanings.sent4: In the world of swearing, he was the champion, able to outswear even the most seasoned sailors.
meanings.sent5: His ability to outswear others was legendary in their small town.

meanings.sent1: He would always outswear his friends when they got angry.
meanings.sent2: It's not a competition, but she can easily outswear anyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The children found it amusing to see who could outswear the others without getting in trouble.
meanings.sent4: His anger was so intense that he seemed to outswear even the angriest person in the room.
meanings.sent5: Her vocabulary of swear words allowed her to outswear anyone who dared challenge her.

meanings.sent1: He always tried to outswear his classmates during arguments.
meanings.sent2: She managed to outswear even the most foul-mouthed individuals in the group.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's routine involved trying to outswear the audience, much to their amusement.
meanings.sent4: In the world of competitive swearing, he was known to outswear all his opponents effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Her ability to outswear others was unmatched, leaving everyone in awe of her linguistic skills.
